pr_title: Add the capability to create reports for our license dependencies in backend

timeline.message: remove execution download for license plugin
put license plugin in top level pom
make aggregated third party license file and rename
add new third party licenses file

timeline.bodyText: Need to investigate, there should be a way to specify this
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
I can now add license information for artifacts previously labeled 'Unknown license' but somehow the original labels 'Unknown license' and 'no url defined' don't go away. E.g:
(The Apache Software License, Version 2.0) (Unknown license) cwlavro-generated (io.cwl:cwlavro-generated:2.0.4.3 - no url defined)
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: According to documentation https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/examples/example-thirdparty.html that is expected result
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: Fixed this so Apache 2.0 is the license; another pull request at dockstore-cli dockstore/dockstore-cli#19 will fix the license information for dockstore-client, dockstore-file-plugin-parent, and openapi-java-wes-client
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: Still looking into how to specify license information for '-generated' artifacts
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText:
Oh, we actually have access to cwlavro-generated, it is https://github.com/common-workflow-language/cwlavro
Just invited you
replies.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
I can now add license information for artifacts previously labeled 'Unknown license' but somehow the original labels 'Unknown license' and 'no url defined' don't go away. E.g:
(The Apache Software License, Version 2.0) (Unknown license) cwlavro-generated (io.cwl:cwlavro-generated:2.0.4.3 - no url defined)
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: According to documentation https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/examples/example-thirdparty.html that is expected result
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText:
Also is there any automated way to create these IDs? Or was this done by hand?
This and the above questions, ideally answered via code comment
replies.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
I was unable to find a way to use wildcards for version numbers
IDs can be created using the command:
mvn license:add-third-party -Dlicense.useMissingFile; which creates a THIRD-PARTY.properties file. Then the license information has to be filled in by hand. Then the command mvn license:aggregate-add-third-party is used to aggregate the license information into THIRD-PARTY-LICENSES.txt
https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/examples/example-thirdparty.html
https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/aggregate-add-third-party-mojo.html
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: Added the tag true which is a flag to fail the build if at least one dependency was detected without a license.
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: if there is a missing license file the command mvn clean install will provide a warning listing the artifact with the missing license. the artifact and the appropriate license string can be added to the THIRD-PARTY-LICENSE.properties file which should then allow mvn clean install to proceed
replies.author: wshands

replies.bodyText: It may be too severe, so others may disagree, but is it possible to make it an error instead of warning? I believe the build is full of warnings, and if the build doesn't actually fail, they may get overlooked.
replies.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: I misspoke, the build does fail and a message tells what the artifact with the missing license file is. The pom.xml tag failOnMissing does this.
replies.author: wshands

timeline.bodyText:
Is this our Dockstore Zenodo client (swagger-java-zenodo-client)? If so, isn't the fix to ensure that it has a license? I don't know why it's not inheriting the license from the root pom.xml.
If you need this, and regarding dockstore-integration-testing/src/license/THIRD-PARTY.properties, is it possible to have the values in the root THIRD-PARTY properties? I feel like it would be easier to manage these in one place.
